kulami.gui

Class Mainframe

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • kulami.gui.Mainframe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Mainframe
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The Mainframe is the central GUI element.

    It depends on a GameController to take care of all functionality. The Mainframe does not have a direct reference to the controller, but forwards all user actions to a MainframeAdapter.

    Displaying the current game is delegated to a GameDisplay and displaying messages is delegated to a MessageDisplay.

    Author:
    gordon
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getMessageDisplay

        public MessagePager getMessageDisplay()
        Returns a MessagePager that can be used to display messages to the user.

        The MessagePager is created by the Mainframe because only the Mainframe knows where it wants messages to be displayed. The controller takes care of sending messages to the pager.

        Returns:
        A MessagePager that can be used to display messages.

      • getStatusDisplay

        public StatusDisplayer getStatusDisplay()
        Returns a StatusDisplayer that displays the status of the current game.

        The StatusDisplayer is created by the Mainframe , but it is the controller who calls messages to the displayer.

        Returns:
        the StatusDisplayer

      • initGameDisplay

        public GameDisplay initGameDisplay(GameObservable game,
                          GameDisplayAdapter gameDisplayAdapter)
        Initializes a new GameDisplay and returns it.

        This method can not be called before a Game object has been created by the controller.

        Parameters:
        game - the game
        gameDisplayAdapter - an adapter for the GameDisplay
        Returns:
        a new GameDisplay

      • displayWarning

        public void displayWarning(java.lang.String message)
        Tell the Mainframe to display a warning dialogue.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be displayed.

      • yesNoQuestion

        public boolean yesNoQuestion(java.lang.String message,
                    java.lang.String title)
        Tell the Mainframe to display a confirmation dialogue with a yes and and a no button.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be displayed.
        title - the title
        Returns:
        true if the user clicked yes, false if the user clicked no

        public void enableOptions(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable the game options.
        Parameters:
        enabled -

      • displayResults

        public boolean displayResults(int pointsHero,
                     int pointsVillain)
        Displays a message with the results of the game and ask the user whether he/she wants to have a rematch.
        Parameters:
        pointsHero - local player's points
        pointsVillain - opponent's points
        Returns:
        true if user wants rematch, false otherwise
